comment: Easy A! If you just do all the work and show up for attendance, you're set. The professor always comes to class in such a great mood and a positive attitude. Super nice guy and cheers for your success. I enjoy the little current news discussions we have in the beginning of class, it's nice to just talk about what's going on. 10/10 recommend!!

This professor went through the death of his brother while I was taking his class and he was still one of the best and most attentive professors I have ever had. You can tell he really cares about the well-being of his students and is more passionate about students' professional engagement on campus rather than the actual class material.

Great professor! Really cares about students and this class is very similar to the previous IS class. Excel and Access assignments, but they aren't bad and it can walk you through the assignment. In all, awesome professor who I would definitely recommend!

Legendary professor. Is much more concerned with teaching you what you need to know to win in the real world than theoretical stuff from a textbook. Do the work and you'll get a B. Study some and you'll get an A. Take him.

Only take this class if you are prepared to teach yourself java. The only thing he gives you are slides + random youtube videos which are not very helpful. If you can teach yourself java, then you will be fine in the class because the assignments are not very hard. Grades consist of assignments, 3 group assignments, tests, and quizzes no lockdown.

He's great! Gives you multiple tries on everything even tests! Lot of busy work but he does give you really good tips like going to school events. My semester was the first half semester for this course. It was great to get it out of the way. That's why there is a lot of work because it was half a semester.

It's a very, very easy course. You just have to show up. You can tell Prof. Howard cares about what he teaches; he would bring relevant news to show the course. The course is stale but more about the content than the professor. Attendance is mandatory, but I would do coursework in class, like a study hall.

Easy A overall, all the work is online and most of it is connect or projects with instructions. No final. Professor Howard is a really good guy and makes the class interesting, highly recommend his class.
This class is so easy. He does cancel class a lot and attendance is bonus. If you want to learn something choose another professor but if you just need credit take him.

Definitely take him for IS 3100. All the work is doable and it would be hard to not get an A in the class. I would take him again. Attendance is for a grade but every class you show up to is taken for extra credit as well in case people cant always make it.

Take him online if you can. No lockdown, a good bit of work but very doable, emails back pretty quickly. Be sure to follow the syllabus because it is easy to get confused what is due for a grade and what isn't. Excel practice work but no projects

Took IS 3100 in person and felt bad for him. The material is bland and he is passionate so he does the best he can. Can't ask for a better experience really. Weekly quiz, occasional Excel assignment, and 2 tests no lockdown. 3 Professional Development events but you can attend them on teams and submit a screenshot. Prof Howard was great.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He is such a cool caring guy. He is always willing to listen to student feedback on the work that we do and is willing to work with you. He doesn't take late work but anything else he can work with you. The class is set up almost exactly like IS2200 without the group project

Great professor, he is extremely lenient and flexible with his grading. Midterm and final were open note with two attempts. Quizzes and attendance were extra credit, not mandatory. There are a few excel assignments that are formatted like a quiz, it will ask you questions and you have to complete the task, but it can all be found on quizlet, easy A
I am pretty sure the professor did not even teach this, and a GTA taught this. It was fine, just do the labs.

the GOAT. Attendance and connect quizzes ended up being extra credit. Excel assignments came with multiple attempts, and midterm/final is open note. Case studies were quick and easy. God bless him for making this course as student friendly as possible.

I am not sure why he is so low on here. Professor Howard is an awesome professor. He looks like he's 30 years old but he claims he's 60. He always asks what students think about each assignment, and he adjusts the assignment based on feedback. This means he can give more attempts on the excel assignments as well. Midterm and Final were open note.

Great class to take if its the only class you have, so many assignments and then they are all so time consuming at first he was giving you a week to do them now he gives you 2 after half the class dropped the course. So much work you have to teach yourself or watch the YouTube videos he has for you cause he doesnt do anything but grade.

If youre taking application development with him good luck. You will literally have to teach yourself Java yourself. He has YouTube videos for you! But he himself doesnt do anything but be a hard grader.

A good lecturer who sometimes went off track or would start answering and talking about completely unrelated questions asked by students. Lecture powerpoints, materials, and tests were all standardized across all sections, but the course was generally pretty easy as long as you paid attention in class and did the labs. Almost weekly quizzes.

Professor Howard himself is a great instructor. He's very knowledgeable about computers, funny, and loves his job. Almost every problem that comes from his classes isn't because of him, but the FYE program. You'll have to teach yourself a lot of things in his class because of this or get tutoring. Fortunately there are alot of resources available.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: He's a really sweet and caring professor. The FYE is not great, so it tied his hands a lot, but I think he's one of the better choices for 1321/1322.

Mr. Howard's lectures are limited by the FYE program, as with all CCSE professors. If you take him make sure to go to office hours with your questions (I recommend showing him quiz questions you struggled with), as he's super helpful/friendly there. He wants you to succeed and makes sure you know about the schedule. Not the best but not bad at all.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: He goes through slides but leaves a lot of his teaching to other professors. Tries to do the minimal amount of work and it shows. Relies on you finding the answers yourself and does not care if you pass or not. I emailed him a question only for him to tell me to ask someone else.

Dexter is a great and entertaining lecturer. I enjoyed his classes and his explanation are very clear and to the point. It is clear he knows what he is talking about. I really enjoying his class and would highly recommend.

He thinks he is the coolest guy in the world and makes sure you know it. Barely teaches a thing, vague study guides, inconsistent tests, ask him anything via email he will more often then not rudely respond. Don't even think about asking him to clarify a mistake he made because he can do no wrong and will always childishly retort back.

Howard is a solid choice if you're looking for someone who knows what they're talking about. If you get annoyed by professors going off on long tangents though, avoid him. The class is just like all other 1321 lecture classes and you're graded by weekly quizzes and your midterm/final/exams. Study for your exams and you'll pass easy.
Takes forever to just go over one thing. Gets side tracked a lot. You will be teaching yourself a lot.
Dont take, does not reply to emails. Not helpful and just not someone I would pick again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Howard is a pretty good professor, he genuinely seems to care about his students and replies to emails fast, and is ready to help. The issue is with the class structure itself. There are 4 tests(lockdown) and a quiz almost every week, but the wording is so off. The textbook is optional but I suggest reading it cause it helps with quizzes.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Good prof to take if you've coded before. If you're not mathematically/logically inclined, don't take him! He often stumbles on his words, gets stuff switched up, etc.. He is a very nice guy though. He answers all questions.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dexter Howard is by far the best teacher for CSE 1321. His lectures are enjoyable and he clearly explains all the topics. Also, he will tell you how the problems on the test will be set up, and when we have had issues he set up a meeting with the other professors to help make the test better. As long as you look over the powerpoints its easy.

Took Dexter for programming 1 and 2. All the mixed feeling reviews below make perfect sense, because as much as he is an amazing guy and great professor, the FYE for CCSE is what the problem of the 2 courses are and he's constantly thrown under the bus to deal with it. If only he was fully in charge of the FYE program and not another terrible prof.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Howard is in NO way involved in the actual class. You will have a GTA teaching you. The FYE is organized very strangely and will require a great amount of self-learning.

The professor himself isn't awful. He responds quickly to most emails but can be quite frustrating to deal with when you ask him a question and he replies with "Have you looked at the lecture slides?" or other responses similar to that. The material we're given isn't always correct and the study guides are quite vague.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I signed up for this professor because his ratings were good. Dexter Howard's name was slapped onto the CSE 1322 class that I took this summer at KSU, but there was 0 instruction from him. The only instruction method was very poor audio recordings of a different professor during his regular lecture. Tests were merciless and asked questions poorly.

Professor Howard is a nice guy, and you can tell he puts effort into his lectures. He doesn't seem to be super knowledgeable, though. Overall, 1322 wasn't great, and KSU's CCSE department can take a lot of the blame for that. The class was easy for me, but I felt it had a lot of room for improvement

He thinks he's a comedy genius, but it's just repetitive jokes. Complicates somethings and makes them hard to understand. He is high energy so if you like him the class is amazing, but I think he was just too much. Also if you ask questions that he feels like he already covered he either ask if you were listening or insults you directly.

Professor Howard was a good guy, but he's not very responsive to emails. ***There will be projects that are obviously harder than they should be, meaning he will give multiple projects that are strictly graded (NOT EVEN BY HIM) and are for upper level coding classes.*** The projects are worth a lot, so you must spend a good bit of time on them...
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Great professor, but maybe doesn't know the content as much as other professors. most students struggle because of the horrid FYE program. Prof. Howard does his best to get you through.

Alright so hear me out. Prof Howard is a great guy and his lectures are actually really fun sometimes. The problem at KSU is the entire CS/CSE/IT departments. The FYE program has destroyed the program and caused most students to do very poorly. All in all, take him if you can, just be ready for the awful department exams and policies...

I don't think he knows the material as well a professor should. I could be wrong (I don't have a degree) but I think he misunderstand questions. I feel like he says "don't worry about it" to another student and I far as I can tell, that not true. I am not learning for the first time but I imagine he could make it very difficult if you are.

Dr. Howard is very upbeat and respected. However, students who do not enjoy sitting through lectures should avoid. Is very thorough and will stick on a subject the entirety of class ( but thats not a bad thing! )
Super fair grading. This guy genuinely enjoys teaching and helping people. I can't wait to take him for 1322, the guy is fantastic!

4 Tests total, you don't have to take any of them but the final. He's super high energy and hilarious, but he can move a little fast. Has a tendency to assume that you understand basic principles of programming, and will skip over them, so just make sure to stop him if you have a question. In short, take him, he's a great guy!
Hes down to earth and wont hold you if hes done with the lecture

For CSE 1321/1322, take him. He was entertaining and informative, despite getting the short end of the stick when it came to the program itself. Yes, the FYE program changes were a disaster, but Dexter was more than happy to go out of his way to help students where he could.

Dexter is not a bad teacher, though sometimes he spends too much time on one concept. A lot of people in my class really disliked him, but for all the wrong reasons. The Computer Science department at KSU is a complete mess, and the students would often take out that on him.

This class itself was not awful, and dexter is pretty cool. However it is in pseudocode, which makes no sense. And the lab that goes with it was awful. the amount of work and difficulty of the assignments for lab were insane. My biggest complaint was that you was expected to already know about coding before the first class.

The FYE program was AWFUL but Dexter himself wasn't. I knew nothing about programming before this class but I went to every class and paid attention the full time. Most of these bad reviews come from freshmen that are used to being babied in high school. This is a class where you have to put in the effort for the A and some people don't like that
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dexter did an awesome job with what the CCSE First Year Experience department gave him. Despite what some of these overly negative views say, Dexter himself was an excellent lecturer and I plan to take him again for 1322. He could be vague at times, but with the way the course was laid out for him to teach it's hard to view in an abstract way.

Overall, the system at Kennesaw is the fault of the class, not Dexter Howard. He is a decent lecturer, who teaches what he is prepared for well, but the unexpected stuff makes up most of the class. Take him if your understanding of code is above average and you are willing to put in a lot of effort out of class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He had funny jokes and was positive. Mainly used power points. Sometimes writing on the small whiteboard. Vague information given. The only grades counted in the class were tests. The tests were made and graded by many different professors, so almost impossible for him to give you proper feedback. "You should already know this" said often.

While the first year experience is undeniably a disaster he is the best of a bad situation. While some of the way test are graded are questionable he is a very caring person and extremely well dressed. His lectures are fine but it definitely helps to cover the material outside of class.

The reason he does not have five stars is because he is not great at answering student questions. Most of his negative reviews come from frustrations due to the shaky curriculum, not of his design. Most that score low do not pay attention in class. He describes in detail what will be on each test. You shouldn't let his low rating deter you.

Dexter Howard-The name sounds very professional and dresses to impress, but his attitude towards this program is not. He goes over the slides carelessly and skips the most important ones. Dex pauses a lot during lectures because he doesn't understand the material himself and raises his voice when he can't answer/understand a question. Disrespectful
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dexter is the best out of all the current professors for this course. You will have to do a lot of self study and teaching if you've never programmed before. At times, he is a little rude to students when he is frustrated, but is overall has a great personality. Only 3 tests, a final, and several online quizzes. Would take over other professors.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The whole FYE is really messy and Dexter made the class more difficult than it should have been. Tests have been the biggest issue with inconsistent grading methods and poorly worded questions. Dexter avoids answering questions, and goes on talking until students forget what they asked. Youll need to teach yourself all the material to do well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Of all the professors in the disaster FYE program,I'd say take dexter for sure. You won't learn much in the class unless you go home and be the professor yourself . He never once has opened a programming language. He just pulls up these slides that doesn't explain anything or even show good examples
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dexters a really nice guy and out of all the FYE professors he's definetly one to take but even still his teaching style is more verbal oriented rather than visual oriented, which is what people who have never programmed before need. This FYE is a disaster and should have never been made but dexter couldn't do anything about it. Definetly take him
